page.title: 09St.Michael Penkevil Church
page.content: The churh was built in 1261 in honour of St. Michael.The first priest was Dominus Willelmus. It has never been a wealthy church.At one time the inside of the church was divided up into panels with plaster mouldings and rosettes which made it look as if it was the inside of a house.By 1862 the church needed restoring and this was done by George Edmund Street.It is built of three different kinds of stone,Pentuan, Portland and a local type called Killas which is like slate and can be easily split. There are several brasses in the church and the oldest is from 1497.It shows John Trenowyth who died 13.3 1497.Admiral Edward Boscawen is buried here.
